item.title: Wide Base Exponential Fixed Investment (also known as “Buy and Hold”): Brokerage ETF, Heng Seng Tech Index
item.description:
I’ve always wanted to do things, like buying a suitable blue-chip stock and just letting it sit, waiting for it to drop so I could assess the situation before adding more, and selling when it rose. The result was that I never managed to do it.

Finding an appropriate blue-chip stock is troublesome; it’s better to choose a broad market index ETF. Currently, my plan is to invest in a brokerage ETF and the Hong Kong Technology Index ETF.

The kind of trading strategy described above has a professional name: bottom fishing (buying back during a leftward decline).

As for the next step, I plan to select a broad market index to thoroughly practice it – achieving an annualized return that outperforms the regular savings account interest rate is the goal.

Brokerage ETFs

A brokerage ETF is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) primarily invested in Chinese securities companies as the main investment target. It mainly invests in the listed stocks of Chinese securities companies in the stock market. Brokerage ETFs typically track a specific brokerage company index, such as the China Securities Brokerage Index.

I previously bought it once, but at that time I was chasing highs and ultimately suffered losses, so I liquidated the position. The Chinese market – whenever there’s a bull run, brokerage companies are bound to rise, and how much they will rise depends on investors’ emotions.

Hang Seng Tech Index

The Hang Seng Tech Index is an equity index launched by the Hong Kong Exchange, designed to reflect the overall performance of the technology industry in Hong Kong markets. The index includes major technology companies listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, covering areas such as internet, e-commerce, cloud computing, and artificial intelligence.

As of May 20, 2025, the top ten constituent stocks of the Hang Seng Tech Index (code: 800700) and their weightings are listed below (data sourced from multiple authoritative sources):

  1. Xiaomi Group-W (01810.HK): approximately 8.82%
  2. Tencent Holdings (00700.HK): approximately 8.14%
  3. Alibaba-W (09988.HK): approximately 7.72%
  4. JD Group-SW (09618.HK): approximately 7.60%
  5. Meituan-W (03690.HK): approximately 7.35%
  6. Kuaishou-W ([01024.HK](http://01024.

Hang Seng Tech Index

  1. ASML Holding (00981.HK): Approx. 5.70%
  2. NetEase-S (09999.HK): Approx. 4.59%
  3. Ctrip Group-S (09961.HK): Approx. 4.48% Total Percentage: Approx. 66.6% (Note: Some sources show the top ten combined percentage between 68%-69%, due to differences in statistical timing points.)

Key Notes

  1. Weight Cap Mechanism: The Hang Seng Tech Index sets an 8% weight limit for individual stocks. For example, before the adjustment on March 2025, SMIC’s weighting exceeded 8%, but was subsequently passively reduced to comply with the limits.

  2. Constituent Stock Adjustments: On May 16, 2025, the Hang Seng Index Company announced that BYD ( 01211.HK ) will be included in the index and Guolian Group (00772.HK) will be excluded. The adjustment will take effect on June 6th. Therefore, as of today (May 20th), the constituent stocks are still based on the pre-adjustment list, and BYD has not yet been included.

  3. Industry Distribution: Among the top ten constituent stocks, internet technology companies (such as Tencent, Alibaba, Meituan) dominate, with significant weights in new energy vehicles (Xiaomi, Ideal) and semiconductors (SMIC), reflecting the index’s coverage of technology and the new economy. Data Timeliness: The primary differences in data from various sources stem from differing statistical time points. For example, data from March 2025 showed a combined top ten share of approximately 69.4%, while data from May 14th indicated 68.82%, reflecting the dynamic impact of market fluctuations on the weighting distribution.

Short Put Cover

The “Short Put Cover” strategy is an investment approach where investors, anticipating a stock price nearing its bottom as it continues to decline, actively buy in batches to reduce their average cost basis, waiting for future price recovery and profit.

This method falls under the category of “Short Trading,” which involves counter-trend operations before the market has clearly established a bottom. Specifically, investors typically employ a “pyramid” or stepped-up buying strategy, gradually increasing the quantity purchased as the stock price declines to dilute the average cost basis. For example, initially purchasing a certain number of shares, if the price continues to fall, the investor increases the purchase volume at a lower price, and so on.

Advantages:

  • Reduce Cost Basis: By buying in batches during the decline, the average cost basis is diluted, creating conditions for future profits. - Pre-positioning: Establishing positions before the market reverses, aiming to secure larger profits when the market rebounds.
  • Disadvantages:
    • High Risk: If stock prices continue to fall, it could lead to greater losses.
    • Capital Tie-up: Requires sufficient funds to continuously add to positions and may face the risk of capital being long-term trapped.

Relatively speaking, “right-side trading” involves buying after market trends become clear and there are definite signs of a price rebound, which carries lower risk but could miss out on initial gains during a rally. Therefore, investors should choose a suitable trading strategy based on their risk tolerance, financial situation, and market judgment.

Valuation Theory

Valuation theory is a core concept in finance that aims to assess the intrinsic value of assets or companies, providing a basis for investment decisions. Through valuation, investors can determine whether the current market price of an asset is reasonable and develop appropriate investment strategies accordingly.

Key Valuation Methods:

  1. Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Method: This method is based on the cash flows expected to be generated by an asset over its future period and discounts these cash flows to their present value using an appropriate discount rate. The DCF method emphasizes intrinsic value and is suitable for evaluating companies with stable and predictable earnings.
  2. Relative Valuation Method: This method assesses a company’s relative value by comparing valuation metrics such as Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio, Price-to-Book (P/B) ratio, and Price-to-Sales (P/S) ratio with those of other companies in the same industry. - Relative Valuation Method is straightforward to operate, widely used for rapid assessment and comparison within the same industry.
  3. Asset Basis Method: This method determines a company’s value by evaluating its net assets – total assets minus liabilities. The Asset Basis Method is suitable for asset-driven companies such as real estate firms or capital-intensive businesses. Application of Valuation Theories:
  • Investment Decisions: Through valuation, investors can identify undervalued or overvalued assets and develop buy or sell strategies.
  • Corporate Mergers & Acquisitions: In M&A transactions, valuation is key to determining the transaction price and influences the success or failure of the deal.

Valuation Theory

  • Financial Reporting: Companies need to assess the fair value of their assets and liabilities to ensure the accuracy and transparency of financial statements.

Please note that valuation results are influenced by various factors, including market conditions, company operations, macroeconomic indicators, etc. Therefore, when conducting a valuation, it is necessary to consider all factors comprehensively and combine qualitative and quantitative analysis to obtain a more accurate assessment.

item.title: No coding, design and develop a self-selected stock module.
item.description:
• Last month, we experimented with cursor, but due to the limitations of the free quota, we didn’t develop overly complex features; we just did some basic testing. We discovered then that Byte also released similar products, both using the same large models – Claude-3.5 – at their core. Byte’s product is called Trae, initially launched in the Mac version and finally released its Windows version in February of this year. Big companies are good because you can freely “white嫖” (literally translates to “free grab”) without paying; you get unlimited use of Claude-3.5. The performance of this model is quite impressive.

Ultimately, we got stuck on the development of candlestick charts. As I don’t understand React at all, I had to give up. To continue developing, I would need to supplement my knowledge of front-end basics, breaking down the task into smaller, more manageable pieces instead of directly giving me a large task: developing candlestick charts.

Issues Found

  • Due to the limited training data caused by using foreign AI models and Vue3 + Element-Plus, React was chosen as the frontend framework.
  • There may be occasional syntax errors requiring manual fixes.
  • Solutions for some complex problems require manual guidance.
  • Code structure optimization requires manual instruction.
  • The most time-consuming part was packaging the frontend code into a container, due to my zero experience with .env.production and tsconfig.json, I had no concept of these either; I sought help from community members along the way to sort out the corresponding logic. There are significant differences between the development and build modes in frontend development, and the checks performed on the code. Backend database and service container scripts were completed in a total of five minutes. Currently, AI primarily improves development efficiency. Having a foundation is best; it won’t solve all problems for you.

Repository Address

As the title indicates, this time we’re going to chat with AI without actually coding and see what we can achieve. Let’s take a look at the final outcome.

Repository Address: https://github.com/ttf248/trae-demo

For detailed usage instructions, please refer to the README.md file in the repository.

The repository contains numerous submission records, most of which are dialogues between me and Trae, as well as my testing of Trae’s functionalities, with notes on whether manual intervention was required to implement each feature.

Prompt

Project is created from scratch, below is the project prompt:

UI and Interaction Optimization

The design of the front-end interface relies entirely on Grok. We initially created a prototype within Trae, but it lacked aesthetics. Because the model used has strong coding capabilities but weaker other abilities, we need to use Grok to optimize the front-end UI.

By taking screenshots of the current interface and uploading them to Grok, we can obtain numerous optimization suggestions at once. We then manually evaluate these suggestions and copy them into Trae to execute and observe the results of the optimizations.

Technology Stack

  • Frontend: React + TypeScript
  • Backend: Golang + Gin + GORM
  • Database: PostgreSQL 17

System Architecture

Backend Architecture

The backend utilizes the Gin framework (Go) to implement RESTful APIs, with the following key modules:

  1. Database Module
    • Utilizes GORM as an ORM framework
    • Supports database connection configuration via environment variables
    • Automatically performs database schema migrations
  2. Routing Module
    • RESTful API design
    • A unified error handling mechanism
    • Built-in request logging
  3. Cross-Origin Handling
    • Supports cross-origin requests from local development environments
    • Configurable CORS policies
    • Supports cookie-based cross-origin access

Frontend Architecture

The frontend was built using React + TypeScript, implementing the following features:

  • Stock list display
  • Watchlist management
  • Real-time quote data display
  • Error handling mechanism

item.title: AI Development Over Two Years: Somewhat similar to the state before a Docker release – chaotic and rapidly evolving.
item.description:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) has undoubtedly been one of the most hotly debated topics in the technology field in recent years, particularly over the past two years, with AI technology experiencing rapid advancements. Whether it’s deep learning, natural language processing, or computer vision and automated decision systems, the application scenarios for AI are constantly emerging. However, despite continuous technological breakthroughs, AI still faces a bottleneck similar to that of a Docker release – a lack of a killer app to truly ignite the market.

Prompt: Write an article: AI has developed for two years, which is somewhat similar to the state of a Docker release before publishing, lacking a killer application, and using existing technologies to create a perfect landing scenario. Docker did not use too many new technologies, but the overall solution is reasonable and changes the workflow of operations and development.

AI Development Status: The Technology is Mature, but Applications Still Need Breakthroughs

From a technical perspective, AI has made significant progress in the past two years. Whether it’s OpenAI’s GPT series models or Google’s BERT and DeepMind’s Alpha series, AI processing capabilities have far exceeded previous expectations. Particularly in the field of natural language processing, models like GPT-4 not only possess powerful generative abilities but also demonstrate astonishing performance in understanding and reasoning.

However, despite technological advancements, AI’s implementation in practical applications faces certain challenges. Similar to Docker’s state before its release, although AI has enormous potential, there hasn’t yet been a truly widespread and industry-changing killer app. People are talking about the future of AI, but they may not be able to find a directly revolutionary application scenario.

Docker and AI Parallels: Technology Doesn’t Have to Be Innovation, It’s About the Solution

Looking back at the history leading up to Docker’s release, we can readily see many similarities between the technological environment at that time and the current state of AI development. Before Docker, container technology wasn’t a new concept; early technologies like LXC (Linux Containers) and virtualization already possessed the basic capabilities for containerization. However, Docker didn’t introduce disruptive technology itself. Instead, it presented a simpler, more intuitive, and efficient solution through the clever integration and optimization of existing technologies. This solution didn’t bring about revolutionary technology, but it addressed many pain points in operations and development processes, significantly simplifying software deployment, scaling, and management workflows.

Similarly, the AI field is facing a similar situation. Currently, AI technology is no longer a “new thing,” but to truly achieve large-scale applications, it still requires a perfect landing scenario. Like Docker, integrating and optimizing existing technologies to form a reasonable application solution. A killer AI application may not rely on groundbreaking technological breakthroughs, but rather how to integrate existing technologies to solve pain points and needs in actual business operations.

How to Find AI’s “Docker Moment”?

To truly enable the widespread adoption of AI technology, we need to focus on several key areas:

  1. Deep Exploration of Real-World Scenarios Currently, many AI applications are still primarily experimental in nature and lack large-scale real-world implementation. Areas such as AI customer service and intelligent recommendations are widely used, but their functionality is still limited and has not yet broken through industry bottlenecks. True breakthroughs may come from industries that have been plagued by traditional methods for a long time, such as healthcare, manufacturing, and logistics. AI can help these companies improve efficiency and reduce costs in complex scenarios through more efficient data processing and predictive analytics.

  2. Productization and Ease of Use Similar to how Docker simplifies containerization processes to increase operational efficiency, the ease of use of AI products is equally important. AI’s proliferation isn’t just about the spread of technology; it’s also about the proliferation of its products. Integrating AI into daily workflows, allowing users to easily utilize these tools without needing to deeply understand the underlying technology, is a crucial step in AI adoption.

  3. Ecosystem Building & Standardization Any new technology’s widespread application relies on ecosystem building. Docker’s rapid rise is due to its openness and compatibility, enabling developers to seamlessly integrate with various cloud platforms, tools, and services. Similarly, the future of AI depends on the construction of an ecosystem. The standardization of AI, model sharing, data openness, and technological interoperability will all influence whether AI can form widespread industry applications.

Conclusion: The Future of AI is Full of Possibilities, but Requires More Refined Implementation

Despite the significant advancements in AI technology over the past two years, it remains in the stage of “lacking killer applications” at present. Similar to containerization technology before Docker’s release, AI needs a reasonable application scenario that deeply integrates existing technologies with business requirements to truly achieve large-scale adoption and widespread use. While technological innovation is undoubtedly important, solutions that simplify processes and improve efficiency are more likely to drive the popularization and development of the technology.

In the future, AI may evolve like Docker – not through disruptive technological breakthroughs, but by integrating existing technologies to create a perfect application scenario, ultimately changing the way we work and live.

item.title: Protobuf Zero Value Pitfall: When Default Values Become an Invisible Killer of Business Logic
item.description:
The US stock market has three trading sessions: pre-market, live market, and post-market. The logic for pushing data – whether it’s full data streams or numerical increments – is optimized to conserve bandwidth (sending as little data as possible). Initially, only the full dataset is sent once, and subsequent transmissions are incremental updates of all fields.

Why not use the optimal solution? This involves multiple project teams, some of which have been live for many years. As we’re a new integration, we can only strive for compatibility.

A Series of Issues

Just from the summary, it might seem like there aren’t any problems, but once the system architecture is brought in, a series of issues arise. Immediately after resolving the previous issue, a new one emerged – this problem was caused by the prior one.

Unable to Identify Trading Intervals

The market phase is defined in protobuf as 0, but because it’s received via incremental push, the business side cannot effectively determine whether this ‘0’ represents the default value or a genuine business value.

In simpler terms: Each time a ‘0’ is received, it’s impossible to discern whether it’s the new market phase setting or the protobuf default value.

Introducing Optional

Since protobuf release 3.15, proto3 supports using the optional keyword (just as in proto2) to provide presence information for a scalar field.

The group’s communication protocol is based on protobuf, but due to historical reasons, the version selected was older and did not support the optional keyword. As you know, because we introduced protobuf from the ground up, publishing the project as a static library, this resulted in needing to upgrade the entire build chain, which was a very high cost.

GCC Version Issues

After painstakingly devising a solution, we planned to release two different underlying versions to control the propagation of dependencies for the new protobuf version as much as possible. However, during compilation, we discovered that the gcc version was too low and did not support the new features of protobuf.

The commonly used server types within our team are CentOS7 and CentOS8. The default gcc version on CentOS7 is 4.8, while the default gcc version on CentOS8 is 8.3. Since the new features of protobuf require a gcc version of 7.4 or higher, CentOS7 could not support it.

Bug 82461 - [7 Regression] Temporary required for brace-initializing (non-literal-type) member variable.

Ultimately, after a lot of troubleshooting, we moved the deployments of related services and the compilation server to CentOS8, resolving this issue.

Reasonable Enumeration

Reviewing the entire problem, there’s a simpler and more efficient solution: adjust the enumeration definition to start numbering from 1 instead of 0. This effectively distinguishes between default values and business values, avoiding all the aforementioned issues.

Why Starting from 1 is More Reasonable?

In protobuf, enum types have a default value fixed to 0. If we define meaningful business values as 0 (e.g., “Market Open”), in incremental pushes, the business side cannot determine whether the received 0 is a business value or an unset default value. If instead, we defined the enum starting from 1, 0 could be retained as a meaningless default value or “Unknown” state, resolving the issue neatly.

Recommended Practice: When designing protobuf enums, always define 0 as a meaningless default value (e.g., UNKNOWN or RESERVED). Assign actual business values starting from 1 to ensure they are distinguished from the default value of 0.

With this small adjustment, we not only resolved the issue of identifying trading hours but also provided a valuable lesson for future protocol design.

item.title: Golden Week and National Day holiday periods saw the stock market’s “ice and fire dichotomy”: dramatic swings between soaring gains and sharp declines.
item.description:
On the eve of China’s National Day in 2024, the stock market experienced a remarkable surge, attracting considerable attention. However, following the holiday, the market unexpectedly turned to a dramatic plunge. This “polarization” of the stock market – a rollercoaster ride between soaring highs and plummeting lows – not only subjected investors to a thrilling yet nerve-wracking experience, but also prompted deep reflection on policy, economics, and market fundamentals.

[Insert relevant news snippets and data visualizations here - this section would be populated with actual content for a blog post]

Pre-National Day Stock Surge: A Policy-Driven Frenzy

Over the five trading days leading up to National Day, China’s stock market surged from a slump into “boiling mode.” On September 30th, the A-share market saw a full-scale rally with all indices hitting historic highs. The Shanghai Composite Index rose by 8.06%, the Shenzhen Component Index increased by 10.67%, and the ChiNext Board Index soared by 15.36%, with the Northern China Securities Exchange 50 Index setting a record for the largest single-day rise, jumping 22.84%. Market sentiment was extremely exuberant, with daily trading volumes across the Shanghai, Shenzhen, and Beijing Stock Exchanges reaching RMB 2611.5 billion, a significant increase of RMB 1155.9 billion compared to the previous trading day. More than 5300 stocks on the main board rallied collectively, creating a “sea of red.”

The driving force behind this rally was the concentrated release of a series of unexpectedly positive policies by the government and the resulting changes in market expectations. On September 24th, the People’s Bank of China announced a cut in the reserve requirement ratio (RRR) and interest rates, reducing the interest rates on existing mortgages, and unified the minimum down payment ratios for mortgages. At the Central Political Bureau meeting on September 26th, it was emphasized that efforts should be made to intensify counter-cyclical fiscal and monetary policy adjustments, strive to boost capital markets, and actively guide medium and long-term funds into investment. On September 30th, a series of ten real estate support policies were released. These policy measures conveyed the government’s firm determination to stabilize the market and promote growth.

Post-National Day Stock Market Plunge: Calm and Adjustment After the Frenzy

However, market sentiment plummeted sharply after the National Day holiday. On October 8th, the A-share market opened strongly with nearly a limit-up rise, but following a significant high opening, the market experienced violent fluctuations before closing down. Since then, the market’s center of gravity has continuously shifted downwards, and as of October 16th, the Shanghai Composite Index rose and fell by more than 15%, cumulatively falling by over 470 points. From October 8th to 10th, core A-share indices all declined, with the Shenzhen Component Index down 6.21%.

The reasons for this plunge are multifaceted, on one hand, digesting the accumulated risks from a rapid rise in the previous period, and on the other hand, related to adjustments in market expectations regarding policy. Some investors believe that the short-term effects of policies have become apparent, but the long-term effects still need to be observed. Furthermore, fluctuations in global markets also impacted A-shares. On October 9th, the Hang Seng Index plunged by 9.41%, and A50 futures fell by 10.

Reflection and Outlook on the Market

The dramatic fluctuations in the stock market around National Day highlighted a deep reflection among investors regarding policy, economics, and market rules. On one hand, the short-term stimulus effects of policies were significant, but their long-term impact remains to be observed. On the other hand, the rapid rise and fall of the market served as a reminder for investors to maintain rationality and avoid emotional investment.

Looking ahead, whether A-shares can usher in a genuine “long bull” market depends on whether policy can effectively transmit to the real economy and ultimately drive substantive improvements in economic fundamentals. Investors should closely monitor the specific implementation of policies and changes in economic data to rationally adjust their investment strategies.

The sharp rallies and crashes in the stock market around National Day were a game between policy and the market, and also a test of investors’ mentality.

item.title: Spring Festival box office *Ne Zha* goes viral/breaks out
item.description:
Here’s the English translation of the provided Chinese text:

“As Chinese people, every Spring Festival, we gather with our families for reunion dinners and watching movies has become an indispensable entertainment activity. This year’s Spring Festival box office hit, Ne Zha, exploded out of its niche, sparking discussions on streets and in alleys. The scale is impressive, reminiscent of the previous blockbuster, Wolf Warrior, carrying a strong patriotic theme that inexplicably evoked a sense of national pride.

Prompt: Write an article, topic: The explosive popularity of Ne Zha at the Spring Festival box office, the inexplicable sense of national pride, similar to older films like Wolf Warrior, with a patriotic theme. While there has been significant progress, it hasn’t reached this level. As gamers, many aspects seem greasy, and the combat scenes are heavily influenced by online games. There have already been people who bought movie tickets for Ne Zha but didn’t actually watch it.”

The combat scenes lacked a certain feel.

As a gamer, I spend most of my time immersed in various online games, so I didn’t have high expectations for movies. However, with the immense popularity of The Battle Between Heaven and Earth, everyone around me was talking about it, and I thought, “Let me take a look.” When I entered the cinema, as soon as the screen came on, my heart sank. Although the production quality had improved compared to before, some scenes looked a bit greasy. Specifically, the combat scenes… well, they were too heavily influenced by games. Having played so many years of games, these visuals and certain scenes felt too similar to what I was used to in games, lacking the texture and feel that a movie should have.

Crazy Fanatics

After watching the movie, I went out to see what was happening online. Turns out, quite a few people said they bought tickets for The Soul of the Demon purely to boost its box office revenue. This is impressive – I have to admit I’m somewhat impressed! It seems that everyone’s enthusiasm and support for this film is incredibly high, and they were willing to do something for it.

Storyline

Let’s reflect on it: back when Wolf Warrior came out, Wu Jing shouted “Anyone who dares to harm China will be punished, no matter how far away,” and countless people felt a surge of patriotism, believing that our Chinese military was incredibly powerful and our country immensely strong. Although The Battle Between Heaven and Earth didn’t have such a direct patriotic slogan, it vividly showcased traditional Chinese culture. Characters like Nezha and Ao Bing, mythological figures we’ve grown up hearing stories about since childhood, had their feuds, loves, and growth journeys depicted with flesh and blood in the film – isn’t that the charm of Chinese culture?

Let’s take Nezha as an example. He was misunderstood and ostracized from a young age, but he refused to give up, shouting “My destiny is not determined by others, but by myself,” which resonates so strongly with the resilience deep within every Chinese person. No matter what difficulties we face, we don’t bow down; we change our fate through our own efforts.

Advancements in Animated Films

Although The Fire on the Mountain (Nezha) had some imperfections, it effectively combined traditional Chinese culture with modern film techniques, allowing us to see significant progress in Chinese animated films. Just as Wolf Warrior demonstrated China’s breakthrough in the action film genre. This kind of advancement makes us feel that Chinese cinema can emerge onto the international stage and allows foreigners to witness the brilliance of Chinese culture.

As Chinese people, no matter where we go, we carry our nation and culture within us. Films like Nezha and Wolf Warrior are like keys that unlock the deep-seated sense of national pride within us. They allow us to feel the strength of our country and the charm of our culture while laughing and enjoying ourselves, inspiring us to work hard in our respective roles and contribute our share to the prosperity and flourishing of our nation.

item.title: Background Service TCP Communication Anomaly Troubleshooting
item.description:
Business Model: The backend service establishes a connection with the group’s market data gateway using TCP. Each time a connection is established, it must first send an authorization request and then continuously send heartbeat packages to maintain the connection status.

However, one day, an alert message was received indicating that the service had disconnected. After carefully examining the logs, it was discovered that the backend service was continuously sending heartbeat packages, but the other party did not respond at all, yet the connection remained open.

On-Site Summary

I was originally working late in the office to advance project progress when an alarm message suddenly popped up in our work group. At first glance, I thought it was just a recurring issue – likely due to network timeouts causing heartbeat failures, leading to service disconnection. However, after careful log examination, the actual situation turned out to be different. The backend had already sent authorization messages, but they hadn’t received any response; meanwhile, heartbeat packets were continuously being sent, yet the other party never replied with any heartbeat data. After in-depth analysis of the logs, several key issues were revealed:

  1. Authorization message without response: This was likely due to the other system being in the process of restarting, which prevented the authorization message from being processed promptly.
  2. Sending heartbeat data despite unsuccessful authorization: Upon investigation, it was found that this was a logical flaw in the program’s logic. - The judgment logic of the heartbeat sending function has a defect; it only checks the connection status but misses verifying the authorization status.
  • If the service can disconnect, a reconnection mechanism can be triggered to resend the authorization message.
  • Currently, there’s one remaining issue that urgently needs to be resolved: why doesn’t the service disconnect? Solving this problem requires more in-depth and detailed troubleshooting work.

Analyzing Network Packets

tcpdump is a very powerful network packet capture tool that can be used to capture network packets. By analyzing network packets, we can gain a more intuitive understanding of the details of network communication. Here, we can use tcpdump to capture network packets for further analysis. Analyzing the data in the diagram, I see that the heartbeat is constantly sending normally, and the other server hasn’t responded with any data, but it has sent an ACK, which prevents the connection from actively disconnecting.

Common Flag Bit Explanation

In the TCP protocol, PSH (Push) and ACK (Acknowledgment) are two important flag bits used to control data transmission and traffic confirmation, respectively. Their functions are as follows:

1. PSH (Push Flag)

  • Function: The PSH flag’s purpose is to request that the receiver immediately push data from the buffer to the upper layer application (rather than waiting for the buffer to fill). This means that once a data segment with the PSH flag is received, the receiver will process and transmit it as quickly as possible to the application, rather than storing it in an operating system buffer.
  • Typical Scenarios:
    • HTTP/HTTPS Requests: Clients setting the PSH when sending requests (e.g., GET /index.html) to ensure immediate response from the server.
    • SSH Protocol: Each keystroke triggers PSH, ensuring real-time transmission of input characters.
    • Real-Time Communication: Low-latency scenarios like video streaming or online games may use PSH to reduce latency. - Note:
    • PSH is not mandatory; the receiver can choose to ignore this flag (but must still process the data correctly).
    • The sender may not set PSH; in this case, the receiver will determine when to push data based on its own buffering policy.

2. ACK (Acknowledgment Flag)

  • Function: The ACK flag indicates that the preceding data segment has been received correctly. Each ACK contains an acknowledgment number (Acknowledgment Number), representing the expected next byte sequence number. It is the core mechanism of TCP reliable transmission.
  • Working Principle:
    • When the sender transmits a data segment, it carries the expected ACK value from the receiver (e.g., ACK = Sequence Number + Data Length).
    • Upon receiving the data, the receiver generates an ACK message to confirm the received byte sequence number.
    • The sender only retransmits unacknowledged data after receiving the corresponding ACK.
  • Example:
    • If the sender transmits a data segment with sequence numbers 100~199, then the expected ACK from the receiver should be 200.

3. Combination of PSH and ACK

In the TCP header, PSH and ACK can appear simultaneously, commonly seen in the following scenarios:

  • HTTP Request Response: When a client sends a POST request (including data), it sets both PSH and ACK (to acknowledge previous responses).
  • Command Transmission after SSH Handshake: After the client enters a command, it sends a data segment with both PSH and ACK to ensure that the command is immediately transmitted and processed by the server.

4. Other Flagged Associations

Flag Name Brief Description
SYN Synchronize Initiate connection (three-way handshake)

4. Other Flagged Associations

Flag Name Brief Description
FIN End Graceful connection closure

4. Other Flagged Associations

Flag Name Brief Description
RST Reset Forcefully terminates the connection (exceptional circumstances)

4. Other Flagged Associations

Flag Name Brief Description
URG Urgent Marks an urgent pointer (rarely used)

4. Other Flagged Associations

Summary

  • PSH focuses on data arriving at the application layer as quickly as possible, reducing latency.
  • ACK focuses on reliable data transmission, avoiding packet loss or out-of-order delivery.

The two work together to balance TCP protocol efficiency and reliability.

item.title: “Making an investment and making money isn’t urgent, and even if you’re anxious, it won’t help.”
item.description:
Reflecting on years of stock trading experiences, although I didn’t make a fortune, I also didn’t lose too much. The biggest issue was an unreasonable allocation of funds and an unstable mindset. Currently, my primary source of income is work, earning a fixed salary each day through part-time jobs. My ability to withstand financial fluctuations remains at the level of bonds and bank deposits. However, people are inherently greedy; if you buy too little, even when prices rise, you won’t make money; if you buy too much, you will lose money. At this point, maintaining a stable mindset is particularly important, as it can help us keep our wealth afloat.

Prompt: Write an article: Addressing the psychological issues in stock trading investment.

Historical Loss Cases

Aside from the initial entry into the market, I’ve encountered small-cap and near-new stocks. Later, my investments focused primarily on blue-chip large-cap stocks: Industrial Bank, China Unicom, HK Electronics, ZTESC, and various large index funds.

“Expecting an annualized return of parlaying with hype about matching bank three-year fixed deposits,” in reality, it was driven by greed wanting more, rushing to add positions early on, and then exhausting cash flow later. Purchases of insurance, buying a house, and getting married all represented significant outflows of capital, leading to insufficient liquidity overall due to a lack of sufficient funds allocated within the broader plan. Buying blue chips is like aligning with “old money”—

  • When Evergrande ran into trouble, bank stocks plummeted dramatically, successfully capitalizing on the opportunity to clear out positions. This reflects a deficiency in understanding for the broader economic market. The real estate sector accounts for too much of China’s economy, and any issues within it have far-reaching implications; it cannot be “force-landed,” leading to continued downward pressure on the stock market. Red-chip stocks like Industrial Bank continued to rise for about two years after that.
  • During the initial stages of the trade war, Zhongxing Telecom was severely impacted, and its stock price also fell sharply. It has since gradually recovered.
  • HSPE (Hubei Hongyu Precision Electronics) is a legacy company; after Ant Financial withdrew, its stock price also plummeted significantly. However, this stock had a controlling shareholder manipulating it, allowing it to surge several times per year. With reasonable position control, losses can be minimized.

Greed: The “Monster” Devouring Reason

Greed is the most common problem in a stock trading mentality. When stock prices rise steadily, and investors’ account profits continuously increase, greed quietly takes root. Many people still fantasize about continued price increases even when stocks are already at high levels, craving more gains and unwilling to cut their profits. They are blinded by greed, forgetting the existence of market rules and risks. For example, during the hype of certain hot-topic stocks, some investors see prices double or even multiply within a short period, falling into it, constantly adding to their positions, hoping to be the last winner. However, the market will not always go crazy; when the bubble bursts and stock prices plummet sharply, these investors driven by greed often suffer heavy losses.

Fear: The “Chains” That Restrict

Fear is the counterpart to greed. It possesses a powerful destructive force in the stock market as well. When market conditions suddenly reverse and stock prices plummet dramatically, investors are prone to panic. This fear erodes their confidence in the market, even when the fundamentals of their holdings are sound, leading them to hastily sell off their shares out of a fear of further losses. For example, during periods of global financial crises, even high-quality blue-chip stocks saw significant declines alongside the broader market. Some investors were consumed by fear and failed to recognize the long-term value of these companies, selling their stock at extremely low prices and missing out on the substantial returns that came with subsequent market rebounds and company performance growth. Fear not only causes short-term losses for investors but can also create a lasting psychological shadow over the stock market, causing them to be reluctant to re-enter investments, thereby losing opportunities.

Blind Following: Losing Direction in the “Fog”

In stock trading and wealth management, blindly following trends is another psychological pitfall that investors easily fall into. In an era of information explosion, all kinds of investment advice, market rumors, and hot topics are rampant. Many investors lack independent thinking and judgment abilities, blindly following others’ operations. When they see their peers making money by buying a particular stock, they immediately follow suit without further thought; when they hear so-called “insider news,” they readily share it. This blind following behavior ignores the research and analysis of the underlying stocks, causing investors to be like lost ships in the fog, losing their own direction. For example, some momentum stocks can generate short-term gains for followers during the initial market hype. However, as the hype fades and stock prices plummet, those investors who don’t understand the situation and blindly follow become “pickup operators.” They fail to realize that each investor’s risk tolerance, investment objectives, and investment horizon are different; an investment strategy that works for others may not be suitable for themselves.

Overconfidence: The Hidden “Rocks”

Overconfidence is also a significant issue in the investment and financial mindset. Some investors, after achieving several successful investments, begin to inflate their egos, believing they have mastered market patterns and can accurately predict stock movements. They ignore the complexity and uncertainty of the market, engage in excessive trading, blindly expand their investment scale, and even use high leverage for speculation. However, the market is ever-changing, and overconfident investors often suffer severe setbacks in a single unexpected market fluctuation. For example, some investors with limited experience who achieved an initial victory believe they possess professional investment capabilities and begin to frequently buy and sell stocks, constantly increasing their investment amount. When systemic risks or sudden negative news about individual stocks emerge, they fail to cut their losses promptly due to overconfidence, resulting in a significant reduction in their principal.

How to Adjust Your Mindset for Stable Financial Planning

  • Establish the Correct Investment Philosophy: Investors should clearly understand that stock investing and wealth management are aimed at achieving long-term, stable asset appreciation, not overnight riches. By learning investment knowledge, understanding market rules, adopting value investing and long-term investment philosophies, and avoiding being swayed by short-term profits and market sentiment, you can make informed decisions. For example, thoroughly research a company’s fundamentals, paying attention to its profitability, industry position, management team, and other factors, choosing stocks with long-term investment potential rather than blindly chasing short-term trends.
  • Develop a Reasonable Investment Plan: Based on your financial situation, risk tolerance, and investment goals, create a scientific and reasonable investment plan. Clearly define key elements such as the amount invested, the investment period, expected returns, and stop-loss points, and strictly execute according to the plan. This can help avoid impulsive decisions made due to emotional fluctuations during investment. For example, set the investment proportion of each stock to no more than a certain percentage of total assets, and promptly take profits when the price rises to reach the expected return, and decisively cut losses when it falls to the stop-loss point.

Control emotions and remain calm: When facing market volatility, you need to learn to control your own emotions, maintain calmness and rationality. You can relieve investment pressure by diverting attention, engaging in physical exercise, or communicating with others, avoiding negative impacts of emotion on investment decisions. When the market experiences a significant fluctuation, first calmly analyze the reasons, combine them with your investment strategy and stock fundamentals, and make rational judgments instead of blindly following trends or panic selling.

How to Adjust Your Mindset for Steady Wealth Management

  • Continuous Learning and Reflection: The stock market is constantly evolving, and investors need to continuously learn new investment knowledge and skills, paying attention to macroeconomic trends, industry dynamics, and company information, and constantly improving their investment level. At the same time, it’s important to regularly reflect on your investment behavior, summarize experiences and lessons learned, identify problems in your mindset and decision-making, and promptly adjust and improve them. For example, after each investment, review the entire process, analyze the reasons for success and failure, and think about how to avoid similar mistakes in future investments.

Investing in stocks and wealth management is a long and challenging journey, and mindset plays a crucial role. Only by maintaining a rational, calm, humble, and independent-thinking mindset can you steadily progress through the waves of the stock market and achieve the preservation and appreciation of your wealth. ## How to Adjust Your Mindset for Steady Financial Planning

  • Continuous Learning and Reflection: The stock market is constantly evolving, and investors need to continuously learn new investment knowledge and skills, paying attention to macroeconomic trends, industry dynamics, and company information, and constantly improving their investment level. At the same time, it’s important to regularly reflect on your investment behavior, summarize experiences and lessons learned, identify problems in your mindset and decision-making, and promptly adjust and improve them. For example, after each investment, review the entire process, analyze the reasons for success and failure, and think about how to avoid similar mistakes in future investments.

Investing in stocks and financial planning is a long and challenging journey, and mindset plays a crucial role. Only by maintaining a rational, calm, humble, and independent-thinking mindset can you steadily progress through the stock market’s fluctuations and achieve the preservation and appreciation of wealth.

item.title: Echoes of Time – Alternative Fantasies and Emotional Refuge
item.description:
As the earliest web novel readers entered middle age, the types of “revenge” stories catered to them also evolved. The protagonists increasingly appeared as fathers, mentors, or elderly figures, reflecting the different needs and desires of middle-aged readers regarding life and emotion. These works no longer solely focused on upgrades and triumphs; instead, they emphasized emotional resonance and life lessons.

Target Audience: Shifting Reader Base Amidst the Passage of Time

Former online novel readers have largely transitioned into middle age. They’ve experienced the trials and tribulations of life, leading to shifts in their mindset and values. The passionate, adventurous elements they once chased are no longer the sole focus for them. Instead, they seek emotional resonance with their current lives and a sense of nostalgia for past years, as well as aspirations for the future. Middle-aged “comfort reads” emerged precisely because of these psychological needs. They utilize plot settings that closely align with the lifestyles and attitudes of middle-aged individuals, attracting this specific demographic.

Role Shift: From Young Hero to Middle-Aged Guardian

My Students Are All the Villains: The protagonist, Lu Zhou, after becoming a master, faces a group of disciples with diverse personalities and formidable strength. They teeter between good and evil, and Lu Zhou must guide them towards the righteous path. This novel showcases the challenges and confusion faced by middle-aged individuals when educating the next generation through interactions with their disciples. Furthermore, the growth and transformation of the disciples offer hope and a glimpse into the future, mirroring expectations for one’s children or younger generations.

Emotional Resonance: Life Reflections and Family Responsibilities

The Sixty-Year-Old Birthday System: The protagonist gained a system upon turning sixty, embarking on a new life journey. This setting allows middle-aged readers to feel a sense of “it’s never too late” hope and inspiration. Even having reached old age, the protagonist can still realize their value and dreams through the system. This plot encourages readers to reflect on missed opportunities and unfulfilled dreams in their own lives, while also conveying an optimistic attitude, encouraging them not to give up pursuing their goals at any age.

Plot Design: Aligning with the Rhythm and Humor of Middle Age Life

Plot designs for middle-aged “revenge” novels often place a greater emphasis on the details of life and the nuanced expression of emotions. Unlike young adult revenge novels that prioritize rapid upgrades and adventures, they focus more on relationships between characters and emotional entanglements. For example, in The Greatest Master Craftsman, the protagonist’s friendship with his apprentice, their brotherhood with fellow disciples, and other bonds were depicted in detail. This plot design allows middle-aged readers to feel warmth and familiarity, as if seeing their own family, friendships, and love in life.

item.title: Spring Festival Blockbuster Movie Ticket Price Mystery: The Difference Between Online and Offline Prices
item.description:
During the Spring Festival, a family of seven or eight people wanted to go see a movie. They originally planned to buy tickets on Taopiaopiao and Maoyan. When they looked at the price, it was 60 yuan. Luckily, they had a cinema recharge card that required them to purchase tickets at the cinema’s front desk. They thought about asking the front desk if there were any discounts, but unexpectedly, the same showtime cost only 35 yuan when purchased at the front desk. The price difference was quite surprising.

The “Hidden Add-on” of Platform Service Fees

While online ticketing platforms are convenient, platform service fees cannot be ignored. They provide users with a seamless booking experience, such as precise seat selection and the ability to view purchase history at any time – all of which require investment in maintenance. These costs are then passed on to consumers through increased ticket prices.

Cinema Differentiation Operation Strategies

With the explosive demand for movie-watching during the Spring Festival, cinemas adopted differentiated pricing strategies to maximize revenue. Online platforms have a large volume of traffic, and many people are accustomed to purchasing tickets online in advance; therefore, cinema ticket prices were set higher on these platforms. Meanwhile, those buying tickets directly at the box office – walk-in customers – received lower prices to attract this segment of the audience.

The Price Logic Behind Revenue Sharing

Revenue sharing models between online platforms and cinemas impact ticket prices. For an online platform to take a slice of the box office revenue – in order to maintain profitability – they will typically raise ticket prices. Meanwhile, cinema box offices have no middleman, resulting in lower costs, which naturally leads to more affordable ticket prices.

Consumer Ticket Buying Tips

Don’t just look at online platforms when buying tickets. Call the cinema’s front desk to inquire about prices, or go directly to the front desk and ask – you might find a surprise. If you frequently watch movies, get an auditorium membership card to enjoy member discounts and save money.

item.title: Analysis of Political Elements in 2025 Spring Festival Film Releases
item.description:
It’s been a long time since I went to the Spring Festival movie release to join in the crowds, and this time I watched two films that felt quite different.

This article explores the new changes in the 2025 Spring Festival movie releases, focusing on Dwelling in the Fuchun Pavilion (Tangrenjie Tanjian 1900) and Nezha: The Devil’s Child. The former utilizes the backdrop of San Francisco’s Chinatown in 1900 to depict the discrimination and oppression faced by Chinese people, reflecting social and political conditions. As an animated film, the latter employs rich metaphorical elements to subtly critique the current international political landscape – such as the Jade Palace resembling the Pentagon mirroring the American political system, the dollar symbol on the Heavenly Mandate Throne symbolizing U.S. dollar hegemony, the jade amulet similar to American green cards representing status levels, and the Soul-Devouring Elixir like a biochemical weapon reflecting malicious actions. Both films offer a new viewing experience and prompt reflection on the relationship between cinematic art and political expression.

Innovation in the Style of Chinese New Year Film Releases

Previously, films released during the Spring Festival often featured lighthearted entertainment and family-friendly themes, aiming to allow audiences to relax and unwind during the holiday season, rarely addressing sensitive political topics. However, in 2025, the Spring Festival release broke with convention; The Mystery Down South 1900 and Nezha: Part One incorporated rich political elements, sparking widespread discussion among viewers and bringing a new atmosphere to the Spring Festival film slate.

“Shanghai Noon 1900”: A Vivid Depiction of Era Politics

“Shanghai Noon 1900” is set in San Francisco’s Chinatown in 1900, a time when Chinese immigrants faced severe racial discrimination and oppression overseas. The protagonists not only have to solve the mystery of the case but also confront discrimination and unfair treatment from all sides of society. The film’s portrayal of racism and power struggles accurately reflects the social and political environment of that tumultuous era, allowing us to see the difficult struggle of Chinese immigrants for survival and dignity, and the underlying political issues worth deep consideration.

Such historical context inevitably reminds us of the challenges currently faced by overseas Chinese in the business sector, such as the TikTok and Zhou Zaikang incident. As of December 6, 2024, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia in Washington, D.C., rejected TikTok’s request, ruling that the congressional law passed under national security grounds requiring a forced sale stood up to constitutional scrutiny. TikTok CEO Zhou Shouheng wrote in a memo to employees that the next step would be “seeking an injunction and awaiting review by the U.S. Supreme Court.” The issue stems from the U.S.’s “Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Control of Critical Technology” Act, which mandates that ByteDance must divest its TikTok business within 270 days after passage of the law, with a final deadline of January 19, 2025.

“The Cop Next Door 1900”: A Vivid Depiction of Political Times

Prior to various hearings, Zhou Haosheng also faced numerous difficulties. On January 31, 2024, the U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee held a hearing on “Big Tech and the Crisis of Online Child Sexual Exploitation,” featuring well-known anti-China lawmaker Tom Cotton. Facing Zhou Haosheng, Cotton fired off eight questions regarding his nationality, including asking if he was Chinese, whether he had applied for Chinese or American citizenship, and even probing into the nationalities of his wife and children. Despite the hearing’s theme being “Online Child Sexual Exploitation,” the legislator shifted the focus to the fact that TikTok, owned by ByteDance (a Chinese company), is a Chinese-owned operation, forcing Zhou Haosheng to answer irrelevant questions. “Just as in The Mystery of Chinatown 1900, Chinese people abroad faced unwarranted discrimination, Zhou Shengyi also encountered unfair treatment and scrutiny in the business sector due to his background with TikTok. This series of events reflects how overseas Chinese have consistently faced formidable obstacles when pursuing their own development and safeguarding their rights across different eras – whether it’s racial prejudice a century ago or today’s political manipulation in commerce – warrants deep reflection.”

“The Deer and the Phoenix: Born to Be Wild”: Political Metaphor Behind the Myth Unveiled

“The Deer and the Phoenix: Born to Be Wild” appears to be a typical animated film, but many of its settings and plots are laden with political metaphors.

  • Mapping of Power Systems: The Yuhuang Palace is shaped like the center of supreme power in the celestial realm, with architectural styles similar to the U.S. Pentagon, primarily using white tones symbolizing Western hegemony disguised under the banner of “universal values.” The “Monster Hunting Team” led by Wuliang Xianzun, with its subordinates Lu Ban and He Feifei, are believed to correspond to the US alliance system of Japan and Korea. The Yuhuang Palace’s “online meeting” scene, where twelve golden immortals gather to discuss the “Battle of Sovereigns,” is like the NATO meetings dominated by the United States, suppressing other countries under the guise of “maintaining order.” - Subtext of Economic Hegemony: The Yu Huh Palace’s celestial tripod used for alchemy, with dollar signs at the entrance, symbolizes America “refining” other nations’ resources through economic hegemony. The Great Immortals Wu Ling Wen used the guise of “upholding heaven and earth” to cast the dragons into the cauldron for refinement, much like some countries exploit “international rules” for their own benefit.
  • Metaphor of Identity and Hierarchy: The fairy identity amulet obtained by Nezha, with its color and pattern design resembling an American green card, symbolizes the immortals’ rejection and hierarchical division of “foreign races,” hinting at the differences in identity and unequal treatment between different countries and groups in reality.
  • Hidden Allusions to Malicious Actions: Great Immortals Wu Ling Wen forced Nezha to take the Soul-Destroying Pill, which resembled a bioweapon, darkly implying that some nations use the guise of “saving the world” to carry out destructive and ruinous actions against other countries.

“The Deer and the Phoenix: Born to Be Wild”: A Political Allegory Hidden Behind Mythology – An Analysis

  • Symbol of Resources and Development: The Seven Colored Lotus, as a key to reshaping Niuwa and Ao Bing’s bodies, symbolizes monopolized energy and technological lifelines dominated by major powers. Its “瓊漿玉液” (琼浆玉液 - Jīngjiāng Yùyuè – literally “jade elixir and pearl liquid”) requires obtaining through the Yu Huang Palace’s “成仙考試” (chéngxiān kǎoshì – “Celestial Transformation Examination”), reflecting developing countries’ reliance on core resources and suffering from “rule-based plunder” within a hegemonic system. The Lotus’ temporary failure and restoration conditions metaphorically represent the survival dilemmas of small nations in an era of energy crises.

Deep Reflections on Cinematic Art and Political Expression

These two films, amidst the nationwide viewing craze during the Spring Festival, incorporated political elements, offering audiences a new cinematic experience – one that moved beyond simple entertainment and served as a mirror reflecting political issues within history and reality. This has prompted us to delve into the relationship between cinematic art and political expression. Will directors in future film creations increasingly convey their perspectives on social and political matters through cinema? As a powerful cultural transmission medium, can film simultaneously engage in artistic expression while also taking greater responsibility for observing and contemplating societal realities? These questions are worth exploring as we appreciate films, and we look forward to the film industry bringing more exciting integration of art and real-world expression.
