item.title: The two major political parties in the United States – the Democratic Party and the Republican Party.
item.description:
The Democratic Party and the Republican Party exhibit significant differences in political ideology, policy proposals, and social values.

Political Ideologies and Policy Positions

  • Democratic Party: Leans towards liberal/left-wing, advocating for the government to play an active role in economic and social affairs, supporting social welfare, environmental protection, and multiculturalism. In tax policy, the Democratic Party supports tax cuts for low- and middle-income individuals while raising rates for high earners and corporations. On social issues, the Democratic Party supports abortion rights, same-sex marriage, and advocates for strict gun control. In foreign policy, the Democratic Party emphasizes multilateralism and diplomatic means, preferring to address global problems through international cooperation.

  • Republican Party: Leans towards conservative, advocating for limited government intervention, emphasizing individual liberty and a free market economy. In tax policy, the Republican Party supports tax cuts, believing they should benefit everyone regardless of income level. On social issues, the Republican Party opposes abortion and same-sex marriage, supports the right to bear arms.

The Significance of Trump’s Ascendancy

Donald Trump was re-elected as President of the United States in 2024, marking a reaffirmation of the Republican Party’s dominance within American politics. Trump’s policy stances included:

  • Economic Policy: Trump advocated for stimulating economic growth through tax cuts and deregulation, particularly supporting the development of traditional manufacturing and energy industries. He also leaned towards protectionist trade policies, renegotiating or withdrawing from existing trade agreements to protect America’s economic interests.
  • Immigration Policy: Trump planned to strengthen border security, restrict illegal immigration, and implement stricter scrutiny and limitations on legal immigrants. He also supported limiting refugees and asylum seekers to maintain national security. - Foreign Policy: Trump favored a unilateral approach, emphasizing “America First,” reducing reliance on international organizations, reevaluating relationships with allies, and employing tougher diplomatic measures when necessary. He also planned to expand fossil fuel production and usage and loosen restrictions on environmental protection.

Trump’s potential second term could lead to significant adjustments in U.S. domestic policy and have profound impacts on global politics and economics. His policies were likely to draw attention and reaction from the international community, particularly in areas such as trade, environment, and human rights.

item.title: ollama local deployment of deepseek-R1
item.description:
Ollama is an open-source AI tool designed to enable users to run and deploy large language models (LLMs) locally. Its goal is to provide a convenient and efficient way for developers to use models like GPT on their local machines without relying on cloud services. Ollama supports multiple models and focuses on optimizing performance, allowing even resource-constrained devices to smoothly run these models.

Through Ollama, users can utilize text-based AI applications and interact with locally deployed models without concerns about data privacy or high API usage fees. You can invoke different models via a command-line interface (CLI) for tasks such as natural language processing and question answering. > ollama is suitable for trying out different models, and after testing the Windows version, it couldn’t fully leverage the hardware’s performance – this may be due to the Windows version. When deploying 32b parameter models with low memory and GPU load, the response speed is very slow.

Hardware Overview

  • Operating System: Windows 11
  • CPU: i7-10700K
  • Memory: 40GB
  • Graphics Card: RTX 3060 12GB

Environment Setup

Add the following system environment variables for easier use:

  1. set OLLAMA_MODELS=E:\ollama This variable specifies the location where Ollama models are stored. E:\ollama is a folder path indicating that all local model files will be stored in this directory. Ollama will load and use the language models you download or deploy based on this path. You can store your model files in another location by simply changing this path.
  2. set OLLAMA_HOST=127.0.0.1:8000 This environment variable sets the host and port for the Ollama service.
    • 127.0.0.1 is the localhost address, meaning the Ollama service will only listen for requests from the local machine.
    • 8000 is the specified port number, indicating that the Ollama service will wait for and process requests on port 8000.

Environment Setup

  • set OLLAMA_ORIGINS=* This environment variable controls which origins are allowed to access the Ollama service.
    • * indicates that any origin (i.e., all domains and IP addresses) can access the Ollama service. This is typically used in development and debugging environments, where production environments usually specify stricter origin control, limiting only specific domains or IPs to access your service to improve security.

deepseek-R1 Model Deployment

ollama installation is straightforward, so we won’t detail it here.

Post-installation verification:

Deploy the model, referring to the official model page and selecting the appropriate parameter version: ollama run deepseek-r1:14b

The 14b parameter version effectively remembers conversation context; smaller parameter versions cannot retain context. The 32b parameter version is very sluggish when deployed locally and hasn’t been further tested.

References

  • https://www.ollama.com/library/deepseek-r1
  • https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/SPEvYTmTBxhoEkJqm1yPmw
  • https://blog.csdn.net/x18990027/article/details/145368094

item.title: PowerShell 7 and Persistent Settings Command-Line Prediction View
item.description:
“I’d gotten used to using zsh on Linux, and when I was writing a blog post the other day, I suddenly realized that PowerShell 7 also supports persistent command-line prediction views, so I tried it out. It turned out to be pretty useful after all.”

“I don’t know what I did to enable this feature, but it just appeared—that’s all.”

e>

PowerShell 7: A Powerful Tool Across Platforms

Cross-Platform Features

PowerShell 7 breaks down platform limitations, allowing you to perform enterprise-level server management on Windows systems, system administration in Linux environments, or daily development tasks on macOS – all with a unified PowerShell 7 tool. This significantly increases productivity and reduces the learning curve and operational complexity associated with platform differences.

Powerful Features

It possesses powerful scripting capabilities, supporting object-oriented programming, functions, modules, and other advanced programming features. Through PowerShell 7, users can easily operate the file system, create, delete, copy, move, and perform other operations on files and folders; it can access and modify the registry to deeply adjust system configurations; it can manage processes and services to effectively monitor and control the system’s running status. Furthermore, PowerShell 7 can interact with various Windows and non-Windows technologies, such as user and permission management in Active Directory and resource allocation and management on the Azure cloud platform.

Open Source Ecosystem

PowerShell 7 is open source, a feature that allows developers and enthusiasts worldwide to actively participate in its development and improvement. A large number of open-source modules and tools are constantly emerging, enriching the functionality and application scenarios of PowerShell 7. Users can find suitable modules within the open-source community to extend the capabilities of PowerShell 7 or contribute their own code to drive the development of the entire community.

Compatibility and Stability

PowerShell 7 maintains compatibility with older versions of PowerShell while introducing many new features and improvements. These enhancements not only improve performance but also increase stability, allowing users to complete various tasks more smoothly and reducing disruptions caused by software failures.

Enable Command-Line Prediction View

Within the many useful features of PowerShell 7, the Set-PSReadLineOption -PredictionViewStyle ListView command is a practical tool that enhances the user’s command-line input experience.

While the command itself isn’t necessary to achieve auto-completion, it only provides in-line completion; once enabled, it allows for prediction view, displaying all possible completion options in a list format. Users can then select the desired option using the up and down arrow keys, thereby improving the accuracy and efficiency of command input.

Methods to Make Commands Persistent

To ensure that the Set-PSReadLineOption -PredictionViewStyle ListView command takes effect every time PowerShell starts, we can add it to PowerShell’s profile. A PowerShell profile is a special script that automatically executes its commands when PowerShell launches.

Determine Configuration File Path

In PowerShell, we can use the $PROFILE variable to view the path of the configuration file. If the file does not exist under that path, the user can manually create it.

Open Configuration File

Use a text editor, such as the powerful Notepad++ or the lightweight Visual Studio Code, to open the file corresponding to the configuration file path obtained through the $PROFILE variable.

Add Command

In the opened configuration file, add the command Set-PSReadLineOption -PredictionViewStyle ListView. Ensure that the command is written accurately to guarantee that the configuration file takes effect correctly when executed.

Save Configuration

After adding the command, save the configuration file and close the text editor. At this point, the configuration file contains the commands we want to execute every time PowerShell starts.

Verification Settings

Close the current PowerShell window and restart PowerShell. In the newly launched PowerShell, when entering commands, the command-line input prediction view style should already be displayed in list view according to our settings, indicating that our settings have been successfully applied.

Through these steps, we not only gained a deeper understanding of the powerful features and characteristics of PowerShell 7 but also learned how to use the command-line input prediction view style to enhance the user experience, and how to make these settings persistent. We hope this knowledge can help you operate PowerShell 7 more confidently and efficiently complete various system management and automation tasks.

References

  • https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
  • https://www.v2ex.com/t/911909

item.title: DeepSeek suddenly went viral before the Spring Festival, NVIDIA stock plummeted: The behind institutional operations and the chain of thought for large models.
item.description:
Prior to the Spring Festival, DeepSeek had become a hot topic, attracting widespread attention on social media in just a few days. This sudden surge in popularity was astonishing and triggered a chain reaction in the market. Meanwhile, NVIDIA’s stock price plummeted, raising concerns among many investors, with some institutions conducting large-scale short selling during this period, seemingly pointing to a “carefully orchestrated” situation.

DeepSeek’s Sudden Surge in Popularity: Rapidly Becoming a Focus

DeepSeek is an AI-powered tool focused on optimizing deep learning models, particularly in the applications of natural language processing (NLP) and image generation. In the days leading up to Chinese New Year, this project suddenly garnered significant attention from investors and tech professionals alike. The performance of its team and the demonstrated technical results sparked strong interest among many. Discussions about DeepSeek dominated all topics within the developer community and on social media platforms.

However, DeepSeek’s sudden surge in popularity was not accidental. After analysis, many began to suspect that certain entities may have been involved behind it.

Nvidia Stock Plummets: The Hand Behind the Short Selling Operation

Nvidia, a global leader in graphics processing units (GPUs), has long been a key hardware provider for many large models and AI computations. With the rapid development of the AI market, Nvidia’s stock has performed strongly over the long term and even become a favorite among many investors. However, with the explosive popularity of DeepSeek and the market’s intense focus on its technology, Nvidia’s stock experienced a dramatic plunge. The underlying cause of this phenomenon may involve institutional investor short selling strategies. Over the past few years, as AI technology has proliferated, Nvidia’s stock price has been significantly inflated, leading many investors to believe that it carries risks of excessive speculation. Particularly after a technology like DeepSeek went viral, some institutions may have profited substantially by shorting Nvidia’s stock.

Chain-of-Thought Reasoning with Large Models: From “Results” to “Process”

In traditional artificial intelligence applications, many practitioners and investors have focused more on the “results” of AI models – such as generated images or text – rather than the underlying reasoning process. In discussions related to DeepSeek, an increasing number of people are beginning to realize that the chain-of-thought hidden behind large models is the core content worth paying attention to. Previously, we could only see the model’s output results, but now we need to understand the logic, algorithms, and how to optimize the model’s performance by adjusting these factors.

This shift in thinking represents a deep reflection on AI research and application. From simple black-box operations to a genuine shift towards understanding the internal workings of models, leading many technologists and investors to re-evaluate the future direction of artificial intelligence. The popularity of DeepSeek perfectly represents a breakthrough in this thought chain; it prompted people to focus on the entire model construction and optimization process, rather than just the final output results.

Summary

The sudden surge in popularity of DeepSeek, NVIDIA’s stock plummet, and the subsequent short-selling activities by institutions – it all seems like a meticulously designed scheme. Through an in-depth understanding of large model chain-of-thought reasoning, we can see that the application of AI technology is not merely superficial layering of phenomena, but also deep digging and optimization of the model’s internal logic. As the technology progresses, we may likely see more innovative tools like DeepSeek in the future, driving AI research and applications to a higher level.

This phenomenon not only shows us the immense potential of AI technology, but also prompts us to start thinking about the commercial games and capital operations behind the technology. The future market trajectory will continue to be a focus of the ongoing battle between technology and capital.

item.title: Is Modern Monetary Theory the future of global economies?
item.description:
The U.S. stock market’s sustained bull run is largely driven by dollar liquidity rather than America’s inherent “hard power.”

Following the 2008 financial crisis, the modern monetary system has gradually become an important theoretical cornerstone for many global economies, primarily emphasizing the subjective agency of large governments in intervening in markets. It utilizes government fiscal deficits as its main tool to achieve full employment while stabilizing inflation. –more–>

What the public is more familiar with regarding large government is Keynesianism, which emphasizes the government’s role in smoothing out cyclical fluctuations – for example, suppressing overheating and stimulating contraction when it’s slowing down. It places a strong emphasis on the multiplier effect of government spending, namely how one unit of monetary stimulus can increase consumer multiplier expansion by a certain amount. When government expenditure 1 opens money, businesses and individuals increase income by 1 unit, businesses expand production and employment, and individuals expand consumption to resist economic contraction. Simultaneously, it is relatively conservative regarding fiscal deficit limits and sustainability. The multiplier effect will drive market recovery, thereby increasing the government’s revenue, especially during the suppression of overheated cycles, which can accumulate funds for stimulating the next cycle, such as the potential debt burden and interest rate levels.

Modern monetary systems are essentially an extension of extreme Keynesianism, but with key differences. The biggest characteristic is the limitation on government debt. Central banks should not have independent autonomy; their primary objectives should be inflation and full employment. Given that inflation is constrained by limited productive resources and technological advancements – meaning the government continuously increases purchasing power into the market through unlimited fiscal deficits as production efficiency rises with technology, ultimately reaching an ideal point of full employment and a production bottleneck – further monetary expansion would trigger inflation. At this point, they choose to cap fiscal deficits, provided there are still idle productive assets available; increasing deficits will not cause inflation.

After the Financial Crisis

Of course, reality is far from an ideal world; execution in each stage involves human participation, and Keynesianism is selectively applied. This leads to more economic stimulus than effective suppression, with economic overheating being used for political gains while suppressing excessive growth is lacking. It’s fundamentally difficult to restrain these issues, resulting in numerous economic problems, and even new financial crises that are no less severe than the economic shocks caused by traditional overcapacity. - The 2008 global financial crisis was, in essence, a market self-reinforcement bubble driven by extreme Keynesianism. It resulted in the proliferation of “odd-shaped” structured financial products – such as real estate and financial investments derived from it – and, crucially, a lack of risk awareness across academia, government, and markets. Debt-fueled prosperity was viewed as an achievement, and many profited from it, including massive financial systems that declared losses were the responsibility of others while announcing profits for themselves. The infamous phrase “you don’t get your money back until it’s gone” ultimately led to widespread investment and the assumption of risk by those who had benefited from earlier stages, culminating in a catastrophic outcome.

After the Financial Crisis

It was after the financial crisis that the shadow of the modern monetary system entered, characterized by rapid monetization of fiscal deficits and central banks’ unlimited quantitative easing, as well as so-called emergency central bank lending policies. The central bank acted as the ultimate lender, supplying an endless supply of bullets, allowing governments to continue incurring debt, and coordinating with fiscal policy. The central bank supported government fiscal deficit spending through purchases of bonds, ensuring consistency of policy objectives. This is also why the boundaries between modern monetary and fiscal policies are becoming increasingly blurred – relying heavily on the central bank’s direct participation in purchasing sovereign debt, a “printing money while buying bonds” approach.

The Eurozone and the United States exhibited similar trends; in 2008, the government debt of the European Union was approximately €6. - 7 trillion euros, with a government leverage ratio of approximately 66%, slightly above the generally recognized warning line of 60%. As of 2014 – that is, during the 5-year period of the bailout – the debt scale reached 9.5 trillion euros, and the leverage rose to 93%. The United States was even more exaggerated; in 2008, U.S. government debt was approximately $10 trillion, which by 2014 had risen to around $18 trillion, and recently it again raised its government debt ceiling. Of course, each drama always used the threat of a government shutdown as a gimmick, but each time it broke through the government debt limit. Currently exceeding $36 trillion, compared to $26 trillion growth since the 2008 financial crisis. Considering the GDP growth factor, the government leverage has grown from 60% to over 120%. The Federal Reserve, as the ultimate lender, played an important role in multiple rescue operations and is one of the main buyers of government debt.

Flaws and Limitations of the Modern Monetary System

This government-led stimulus scheme, though not a planned economy, faces consistent problems. How can you guarantee the market’s omniscience and all participants’ selfless dedication at every stage? Let’s take a simple example: if a government department increases its budget for a particular direction by 1 million, is it going to go to the mayor’s nephew or a more cost-effective market bidding process? Of course, in reality, interests will form in increasingly complex ways, leading to the result that even though the government expands debt and spending, it flows completely out of control. The recent American establishment of an Office of Efficiency is an extension of this type of problem. These issues manifest differently across varying corrupt economies; we’re focusing on discussing the more prevalent problems.

1. Inflation Issues

With the development of the modern information network, governments have a much greater grasp on market information than in the past. However, this isn’t omniscience – markets inherently contain variables and are constantly subject to change based on expectations, entering a recursive loop (“the ouroboros”). I anticipate your predictions. Taking actual performance as an example, despite the relatively successful implementation of Modern Monetary Theory between 2008 and 2020—achieving short-term economic recovery and inflation stabilization, with even the Eurozone experiencing phase deflation and US inflation largely remaining within the expected 1-3% range—this led people to believe in increasingly extreme tools, much like they once believed in Keynesianism. Looking back, this was primarily due to the continued high growth trend of manufacturing in developing countries after 2008. For example, China, which gradually established itself as a global production powerhouse during this period, along with other emerging economies like Southeast Asia and India, maintained relatively high levels of industrial value added. This effectively offset the largest constraint within the Modern Monetary Theory – resource supply limitations – allowing both Europe and the United States to sustain comparatively stable inflation even amidst de-industrialization and excessive financialization, alongside increased government debt and a surge in monetary supply.

1. Inflation Issues

However, after 2020, with the use of larger-scale stimulus policies, both the Eurozone and the United States experienced relatively significant inflation, peaking at around 10%, even today, despite interest rate hikes lasting nearly three years, the U.S. labor market continues to show an abnormal overheating, and financial markets have seen a divergence from economic growth supported by monetary support, with inflation running towards 3% as the base effect disappears. This overheating phenomenon during interest rate hikes is closely related to fiscal deficits. Interest rate hikes are a contractionary monetary policy, while fiscal policy remains expansionary, compounded by the ultra-massive monetary injection of 2020, which has made U.S. inflation remarkably persistent. The biggest limitation of Modern Monetary Theory is high inflation.

2. Government Debt Issues

In principle, governments can indefinitely finance debt repayment through borrowing, provided that the central bank becomes a complete puppet – meaning full alignment of monetary and fiscal policy objectives within a modern monetary system. However, the Federal Reserve is unlikely to fully cede control to the government, given the accumulated government debt balance over many years, particularly interest expenses, which are increasingly becoming a significant burden on finances.

Fiscal Year 2023: In fiscal year 2023, U.S. revenue totaled $4.439 trillion, with interest expense on the debt accounting for approximately 15% of that revenue. In 2024, this high-interest environment continued, according to data released by the U.S. Treasury Department.

Fiscal Year 2024: The U.S. federal government’s budget deficit reached $1.833 trillion, with net interest payments totaling $882 billion – approximately 18% of U.S. federal revenue, even exceeding Social Security expenditures.

2. Government Debt Issues

This is the issue of fiscal sustainability. If low interest rates and low inflation, combined with high debt (such as Japan’s), are maintained over the long term, it can indeed form an application of modern monetary theory in this way. According to the 72 rule, as long as interest rates are sufficiently low, incremental debt financing will be very slow. If the cost of capital is 1%, debt-funded growth can reach twice the debt level in 72 years. Assuming inflation breaks this delicate balance, interest payments on debt accumulate, leading to compound interest and causing future debt trajectories to spiral out of control. Principal becomes a secondary factor. If the central bank then deviates from the goals of the ruling party, these issues will become even more acute. “The Trump administration’s policy stances sharply contrasted with the Fed’s hawkish stance at the time, which was also a key factor in the escalation of relations between the government and the Fed during his term. The focus for most observers is likely whether the current chairman can successfully complete his term.”

3. Financial Bubbles and Monetary Credit Issues

Ideally, the government’s expanded spending enters both households and businesses, leading to increased expenditure and a boost in effective demand. However, given that people are all experienced participants in numerous financial bubbles since 2000, individuals tend to exhibit a significant investment appreciation bias in their choices between investing and consuming, particularly when one or more products with extremely high expected returns appear. People will flock to the financial markets seeking higher gains, even willing to compress living standards and take on additional leverage. This is similar to what occurred during periods of high real estate growth in Japan, the United States, and China. Combining policy stimulus with the pursuit of maximum self-interest by practitioners, issues such as subprime loans are prevalent. Many so-called “rescue” policies actually encourage borrowing. Therefore, history has shown a remarkable consistency: when large-scale monetary and fiscal policies are deployed, it often results in a frenzy of asset bubbles and wealth redistribution. Asset bubbles occur first, followed by wealth redistribution, which leads to another problem – extreme Keynesianism or Modern Monetary Theory’s persistent tendency towards economic Ponzi schemes (Minsky Moment). As long as there is hot money, asset prices continue to rise. As long as they continue to rise, it attracts later entrants holding cash, while the CPI, measuring changes in basic living expenses, doesn’t change significantly. Money circulates within specific sectors and becomes worthless for later entrants. After the frenzy comes the collapse, which is Minsky Moment’s relentless vindication.

  • Financial Bubbles and Monetary Credit Issues

Furthermore, money itself has a supply and demand relationship. When the market supply is excessive, and traditional investment assets cannot accommodate it, or when it has been harvested too many times and cannot attract investment, such as repeatedly collapsing real estate bubbles (Japanese people haven’t dared to touch real estate investments for decades), tax policies that increase property holding taxes to reduce speculative demand, will increase the cost of financial speculation. In a situation of excessive monetary supply, the market urgently needs investment assets that are tax-free, and various virtual investment products have emerged. Even U.S. President and First Lady have come in to share a cup, one saying is to dig into the dollar wall, but in fact it’s the inevitable result of currency abuse and financial emptiness under global monetary issuance and currency credit damage, challenging the modern monetary theory’s reliance on national monopoly rights-based credit money status, even facing challenges. What kind of soil breeds what kind of financial games.

Financial Bubbles and Monetary Credit Issues

In summary, modern monetary theory and Keynesianism are more like progressive and substitutional relationships, placing a greater emphasis on government intervention in markets and adopting a more radical attitude towards fiscal deficits and the independence of central banks. Excessive use of Keynesianism led to stagflation and financial crises. Following this artificial economic overheating, modern monetary theory quietly took over after 2008. Under globalization, continued productivity gains allowed for rapid growth recovery and maintained inflation levels in using countries, but it also accumulated massive government debt and financial bubbles. When inflation rebounded, with inconsistent goals between central banks and governments, high interest rates and high leverage coexisted, significantly increasing the fiscal burden of government monetization. Fiscal sustainability was drastically reduced, and due to excessive government participation, base monetary injections led to financial bubbles. Unending money printing weakened the currency itself, appearing strong but merely a reflection of others. This also created fertile ground for various new types of speculative financial investment tools, even escaping traditional financial investment tax restrictions. This is a microcosm of the global economy. Modern Monetary Theory (MMT) may not be the future, but rather a past tense used from 2008 onwards, layered with reverse economic globalization. The more financial bubbles were inflated, the higher government debt accumulated, the more frantic the financial speculation tools became, and the greater the efficiency in achieving distorted wealth distribution – the greater the risk of a hard landing, including economic and social risks. Whether Keynesianism or MMT, no matter how much monetary supply is increased, it cannot truly solve the wealth structure problem; instead, it exacerbates risks within asset bubbles and financialization. People are constantly falling into the same pit in different postures repeatedly, but they never learn anything from it.

item.title: Mastering atop: A Comprehensive Guide to Monitoring Linux System Metrics – Installation, Configuration, and Usage
item.description:
In Linux system administration, real-time and comprehensive monitoring of system resources and process status is crucial. The atop tool, as a powerful monitoring utility, helps us easily achieve this goal. This article will provide a detailed introduction on how to install, configure, and use the atop monitoring tool in a Linux instance.

I. atop Tool Introduction

atop is a tool specifically designed for monitoring Linux system resources and processes. It records the activity of systems and processes, and reports on the running status of all processes. The data collected by this tool covers resource usage such as CPU, memory, disk, and network, as well as process states. It can also save the data in log files to disk. For each process, we can obtain key information such as CPU utilization, memory growth, disk usage, priority, username, status, and exit code. Furthermore, through the atop configuration file, we can customize parameters such as logging collection frequency, log file storage path, and rotation strategy.

II. Installing the atop Tool

The installation method for atop varies slightly depending on the Linux distribution. The following provides an introduction based on common operating systems:

  1. Alibaba Cloud Linux 3/2, CentOS 7/8, Fedora, Rocky Linux 9:

    • Execute the installation command: sudo yum install -y atop
    • Start the atop service: sudo systemctl start atop

  2. Ubuntu / Debian:

    • Update the software source list: sudo apt update
    • Execute the installation command: sudo apt install -y atop
    • Start the atop service: sudo systemctl start atop

  3. CentOS Stream 9:

    • Download and install: sudo wget https://www.atoptool.nl/download/atop-2.11.0-1.el9.x86_64.rpm && sudo rpm -i atop-2.11.0-1.el9.x86_64.rpm
    • Start the atop service: sudo systemctl start atop

II. Installing the atop Tool

  • openSUSE:
    • Execute the installation command: sudo zypper install -y atop atop-daemon
    • Start the atop service: sudo systemctl start atop If your distribution is not listed above, you can visit the official atop website for installation information.

III. Configuring Monitoring Cycle and Log Retention Time

  1. Configuration File Location: In Alibaba Cloud Linux 3/2, CentOS 7/8, and Fedora systems, the atop configuration file is /etc/sysconfig/atop; in Ubuntu, Debian, and openSUSE systems, the configuration file is /etc/default/atop.
  2. Default Configuration Parameter Explanation
    • LOGOPTS: Controls logging options for log files, defaults to empty.
    • LOGINTERVAL: Monitoring cycle, default is 600 seconds. To collect historical logs for tracking issues, it’s recommended to adjust this frequency based on actual needs.
    • LOGGENERATIONS: Log retention time, default is 28 days.
    • LOGPATH: Log file storage path, defaults to /var/log/atop.

III. Configure Monitoring Cycle and Log Retention Time

  • Configuration Steps
    • Execute the command to open the configuration file:
      • In Alibaba Cloud Linux 3/2, CentOS 7/8, Fedora systems: sudo vim /etc/sysconfig/atop
      • In Ubuntu, Debian, openSUSE, CentOS Stream 9, Rocky Linux 9 systems: sudo vim /etc/default/atop
    • Press ‘i’ to enter edit mode and adjust the configuration parameters according to your needs. For example, change the monitoring cycle to 30 seconds, set the log retention time to 7 days, and maintain the default log path:
    • Press ‘Esc’ to return to normal editing mode, type :wq to save and exit.
    • Restart the atop service to apply the configuration: sudo systemctl restart atop

Four. Using atop Tool

  1. Common Commands: In interactive command mode, the following common commands are available:
    • g: Return to the default comprehensive output view.
    • c: Display the complete command line for each process.
    • m: Sort processes by memory usage in descending order.
    • d: Sort processes by disk usage in descending order.
    • a: Sort processes by overall resource usage in descending order.
    • n: Sort processes by network usage in descending order.
    • t: Jump to the next monitoring collection point.
    • T: Jump to the previous monitoring collection point.
    • b: Specify a timestamp in the format YYYYMMDDhhmm.

Four. Using the atop Tool

  • Resource Monitoring Field Meanings
    • atop: Hostname, sampling date and time point.
    • PRC: Overall process running status, including kernel state and user state runtime, total process count, number of processes in different states, etc.
    • CPU: Overall CPU usage, the sum of the numbers is N*100% (N is the number of CPU cores), including the proportion of time for kernel state, user state, interrupt, idle, and disk I/O waiting.
    • CPL: CPU load status, such as the average number of processes in the queue over 1 minute, 5 minutes, and 15 minutes, context switch times, and interrupt occurrences.
    • MEM: Memory usage, including total physical memory, free memory, page cache memory, file cache memory, and kernel occupied memory, etc. - SWP: Swap space utilization, including total swap area and available swap space size.
  • PAG: Virtual memory page situation, such as inbound and outbound memory page numbers.
  • DSK: Disk usage, with each disk device corresponding to a column, displaying device identifier, busy time proportion, read/write request quantity.
  • NET: Network status, showcasing transport layer TCP and UDP, IP layer, and receive and send packet sizes for each active port.

Four. Using the atop Tool

  • View Real-time System Metrics
    • View system metrics every 5 seconds: atop 5
    • View system metrics from the last 30 intervals (each interval is 10 seconds) after the current time: atop -M 10 30
    • View system metrics from the last 10 minutes (10 intervals, each interval is 60 seconds), and write the results to a file: atop -M 60 10 > /log/atop.mem
  • View Historical Metric Logs: After atop starts, collected records are stored by default in the /var/log/atop directory. When viewing, be sure to specify the date of the log file must exist, otherwise it will error. - View daily historical metrics log: atop -r
  • View yesterday’s historical metrics log: atop -r y
  • View historical metrics log for a specific date, such as November 6, 2024: atop -r 20241106
  • View historical metrics log from a specific date and time, such as starting from November 6, 2024, 14:00: atop -r 20241106 -b 14:00
  • View historical metrics log for a specified time range on a specific date, such as from November 5, 2024, 00:04 to 00:08: atop -r 20241105 -b 00:04 -e 00:08 ## Four. Using the atop Tool
  • View Real-time System Metrics
    • View system metrics every 5 seconds: atop 5
    • View system metrics from the last 30 intervals (each interval is 10 seconds) after the current time: atop -M 10 30
    • View system metrics from the last 10 minutes (10 intervals, each interval is 60 seconds), and write the results to a file: atop -M 60 10 > /log/atop.mem
  • View Historical Metric Logs: After atop starts, collected records are stored by default in the /var/log/atop directory. When viewing, be sure to specify the log file for the desired date; otherwise, an error will occur.

Four. Using the atop Tool

  • View System Activity Report
    • View the CPU utilization report for the current system over 1 minute (12 times, with an interval of 5 seconds): atopsar -c 5 12
    • View the memory metrics report for a specified time period during the day, such as 18:00 to 18:01: atopsar -m -b 18:00 -e 18:01
    • View the memory metrics report for a specified date and time period, such as November 5, 2024 from 18:00 to 18:01: atopsar -m -r 20241105 -b 18:00 -e 18:01

Five. Other Operations

  1. Configure Daily Log Rotation Policy: If you want to generate a daily atop metric log file, you can perform the following actions:
    • (Optional) Adjust monitoring period, log retention time, and log storage path according to your needs.
    • Execute the command to enable and start the services related to daily log rotation: sudo systemctl enable --now atop atopacct atop-rotate.timer
    • If your business has more complex requirements for log processing, you can also combine it with logrotate or custom scripts to implement log management.

Five. Other Operations

  • Load the optional netatop kernel module: If you need to monitor network usage, you can install the netatop module (the module is not installed by default in atop). As an example on Alibaba Cloud Linux 3:
    • Install the kernel development package and the software environment required for compiling: sudo yum install -y kernel-devel dkms elfutils-libelf-devel
    • Download the latest version of netatop source code to a specified directory: cd /usr/src/ && sudo wget https://www.atoptool.nl/download/netatop-3.2.2.tar.gz --no-check-certificate
    • Extract the source code and enter the source code directory: sudo tar -zxvf netatop-3.2.2.tar.gz && cd netatop-3.2.2
    • Build and install the module and daemon based on the source code: sudo make && sudo make install
    • Start the netatop service: sudo systemctl start netatop

V. Other Operations

The atop tool is powerful and flexible to use. By installing, configuring, and using it properly, we can better understand the running status of our Linux system and promptly identify and resolve potential issues. We hope this article will help everyone take Linux system monitoring to a new level.

VI. References

  • atop official website
  • Installation, configuration, and usage of the atop monitoring tool

item.title: Understanding “buy rate” and “sell rate” in exchange rates
item.description:
In the foreign exchange market, particularly at banks or currency exchange points, we often see terms like “buy rate” and “sell rate.” Many people may not be clear about these concepts, or even confuse them. Today, let’s help everyone understand the meaning of these rates and their functions through a simple example.

1. What are “Buy Rate” and “Sell Rate”?

  • Buy Rate: The bank or currency exchange institution is willing to purchase foreign currencies at this rate, meaning when you sell your foreign currency (such as US dollars) to the bank, the bank will pay you RMB according to the buy rate.
  • Sell Rate: The bank or currency exchange institution is willing to sell foreign currencies at this rate, meaning when you buy foreign currency with RMB, the bank will sell you the foreign currency at the sell rate.

Simply put:

  • Buy Rate: The price at which the bank buys foreign currency from you.
  • Sell Rate: The price at which the bank sells foreign currency to you.

It is important to note that the buy and sell rates of banks are usually different, and the sell rate is generally higher than the buy rate. This difference is the source of profit for the bank.

2. Specific Case Analysis

To help everyone better understand the practical application of these exchange rates, let’s look at a specific example: Assume you go to a bank to exchange dollars, and the bank provides the following exchange rate:

  • Buy Rate: 1 US Dollar = 7.0 RMB
  • Sell Rate: 1 US Dollar = 7.2 RMB

Scenario 1: You Sell US Dollars to a Bank

Assume you have $1000 and want to sell it to a bank. The bank will calculate the transaction using the buying rate:

\[ $1000 \times 7.0 \, \text{Renminbi/USD} = 7000 \, \text{Renminbi} \]

This means the bank will give you 7000 RMB. The exchange rate is the buying rate because you are selling US dollars to the bank.

Scenario Two: You Buy US Dollars with Renminbi

Assume you have 7,000 RMB and want to exchange it for US dollars. The bank will calculate the amount in USD based on the selling rate:

\[ 7000 \, \text{RMB} \div 7.2 \, \text{RMB/USD} = 972.22 \, \text{USD} \]

In this case, you can exchange 7,000 RMB for approximately 972.22 USD. The exchange rate here is the selling rate, because you are purchasing USD from the bank.

3. Why Buying and Selling Currency Differ?

You may have noticed that a bank’s buying rate (7.0 RMB/USD) is lower than its selling rate (7.2 RMB/USD). This is because banks typically profit from this exchange rate spread when engaging in foreign exchange transactions. In other words, banks earn profits by charging a higher selling rate and paying a lower buying rate.

For example, in the above case, the bank’s spread is:

\[ \text{Selling Rate} (7.2) - \text{Buying Rate} (7.0) = 0.2 \, RMB \]

This difference in price is the source of the bank’s profit.

4. Summary

  • Buying Rate: The bank buys foreign currency from you at this rate (the same rate you sold the foreign currency for).
  • Selling Rate: The bank sells foreign currency to you at this rate (the same rate you bought the foreign currency for).
  • Exchange Rate Difference: The difference between the buying and selling rates is the bank’s profit margin.

Understanding these two rate concepts allows us to clearly know how much foreign currency we will receive, or how much Renminbi we need to spend to buy foreign currency when conducting foreign exchange transactions. We hope this simple example helps everyone better understand the basic principles of foreign exchange rates!

item.title: Visual Studio loading a mismatched PDB file
item.description:
When debugging programs under Windows using Visual Studio, if the PDB file does not match the executable file, Visual Studio will display “Unable to load symbol file.” The program crashes and generates a crash dump. If it’s an mismatched PDB file, Visual Studio cannot smoothly enter the crash site.

What is a PDB File?

A PDB file is a debugging information file created by Microsoft, used for debugging programs. It contains information such as the symbol table, source code filenames, line numbers, and other debugging data. A PDB file can be generated during program compilation to aid in debugging.

WinDbg Debugging

WinDbg is a debugging tool from Microsoft that can be used to debug Windows programs. WinDbg can load mismatched PDB files, but this requires manual loading. The .reload /f /i command forces the loading of mismatched PDB files.

However, WinDbg is less convenient to use than Visual Studio, so we want Visual Studio to also be able to load mismatched PDB files.

Visual Studio Cannot Load Matching PDB Files

Source code is now generally managed through Git, allowing you to find the corresponding version of the code and recompile it to generate a matching PDB file. Why can’t it load? The main reason is that metadata doesn’t match.

There’s a small tool that can modify metadata based on EXE file information to generate a new PDB file, enabling Visual Studio to load it.

Chkmatch Download Address: https://www.debuginfo.com/tools/chkmatch.html Site Cache Address: chkmatch.zip

Using chkmatch

First, perform the check operation to analyze the cause of mismatches and prompt an error indicating signature mismatch. Then, execute the modify operation to ensure that the pdb file matches the executable file.

References

  • forcing-to-load-unmatched-symbols-in-visual-studio-2015-debugger

item.title: Cursor AI Programming IDE Trial
item.description:
It seems like another year has passed, and the biggest change at work is a significantly increased involvement of AI. Previously, switching between different development languages required developers to be familiar with various language-specific API interfaces. Now, these basic code snippets can all be generated by AI, which is a huge blessing for developers.

ChatGPT

As early as 2023, I’ve written two simple introductory articles about it. Now it’s been 25 years – how to put this… I haven’t felt a significant improvement. It still needs to develop its own cognition, be able to reasonably break down tasks, and, of course, most importantly, identify whether AI-generated code contains bugs.

Github Copilot

It was a long time ago, but I saw some information saying that Singapore deployed the server and it’s available for use in China. No longer need to maintain a VPN for extended periods. Of course, you still need to connect to a VPN when logging in, but this VPN only needs to be used during login, and then you can turn it off.

In daily use, Github Copilot is also heavily relied upon. This plugin can be directly used in VS Code and Visual Studio without switching between the two applications. Compared to ChatGPT, Github Copilot provides better support for projects, a more user-friendly interaction, and allows you to feed partial local files to it – “training” the AI – so that the generated code is more aligned with your project.

Cursor AI

Recently I’ve come across a new AI programming IDE, Cursor AI. This IDE is based on Github Copilot, but it’s more intelligent and can help you create files directly. I gave it a quick try and found it to be pretty good, however, its understanding of existing projects isn’t quite there yet. When dealing with large local project files, or major refactoring, optimization, and adjustments, developers still need to break down tasks. item.title: C++ Bitwise Operations Fundamentals: Bitwise Extraction and Flag Setting
item.description:
In actual C++ development, bitwise operations are a common technique, especially when dealing with system states, flags, or control bits. Bitwise operations can provide highly efficient solutions. This article will illustrate how to use bitwise operations to retrieve and set specific flags through an example.

Bitwise Operations Fundamentals

In computers, data is stored in binary bits (0 and 1). Bitwise operations are operations performed on these binary bits. C++ provides several commonly used bitwise operators:

  • Bitwise AND (&): Used to check if a particular bit is set to 1.
  • Bitwise OR (|): Used to set a particular bit to 1.
  • Bitwise XOR (^): Used to flip a particular bit.
  • Bitwise NOT (~): Inverts all the bits.
  • Left Shift («): Shifts all the bits to the left by a specified number of positions.
  • Right Shift (»): Shifts all the bits to the right by a specified number of positions. In this example, we need to perform a series of bitwise operations on an unsigned short variable wInfo to represent different states using various flags.

Requirement Analysis

Based on the description, we have a 16-bit flag to represent different states. These states are represented by various binary bits, with each binary bit corresponding to a specific meaning. For example:

  • bit0: Failure status
  • bit1: Compression status
  • bit2: Incremental status
  • bit3: Presence of subsequent packets
  • bit5: Normal request or cancellation

Using Bitwise Operations

We will use bitwise operations to set and retrieve these flags. Specifically:

  • Bitwise AND: Retrieve the value of a particular bit (0 or 1).
  • Bitwise OR: Set a particular bit to 1.
  • Bitwise XOR: Set a particular bit to 0.

We first define an unsigned short type variable wInfo to store these flags. Then, we use bitwise operations to check and set the corresponding flags.

C++ Example Code

Execute the code, recommended for old friends: https://wandbox.org/

Code Explanation

  1. Flag Definition: Use shift operations (1 << n) to define each flag bit. For example, 1 << 0 corresponds to bit0, 1 << 1 corresponds to bit1, and so on. This way, we allocate a unique binary position for each flag.
  2. Check a Bit: The isBitSet function uses the bitwise AND operation (wInfo & bitMask) to check if a specific flag is set to 1. If the bit is 1, the function returns true, otherwise it returns false.
  3. Set a Bit: The setBit function uses the bitwise OR operation (wInfo |= bitMask) to set a specific flag bit to 1.
  4. Clear a Bit: The clearBit function uses the bitwise AND operation (wInfo &= ~bitMask) to clear a specific flag bit to 0.

Summary

Through bitwise operations, we can efficiently handle multiple state flags. This technique is particularly useful in practical development. For example, in embedded development, network protocols, and system status management scenarios, bit flags are often used to represent multiple binary states, saving space and improving efficiency.

We hope this blog post helps you understand how to use bitwise operations in C++ to perform bitwise selection and setting, and mastering these skills is very helpful for writing efficient and maintainable code!
